title: Asparagus Salad Recipe
description: This asparagus salad with grilled lemony asparagus spears, spinach, Parmesan, and crunchy almonds makes a quick and tasty addition to any summer meal.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Salad Vegetable Salad Recipes Asparagus Salad Recipes Asparagus Salad 4.8 (71) 61 Reviews 5 Photos I made this asparagus salad one summer evening when I had spinach and Parmesan cheese in the fridge and combined them with grilled asparagus — I was delighted with the outcome. My husband and I love it! Submitted by Heather Hedstrom Updated on February 26, 2025 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 5 5 5 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 5 mins Total Time: 15 mins Servings: 6 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings ¼ cup olive oil 2 tablespoons lemon juice 12 fresh asparagus spears 6 cups fresh spinach leaves 2 tablespoons grated Parmesan cheese 1 tablespoon seasoned slivered almonds Directions Preheat an outdoor grill for low heat and lightly oil the grate. Combine oil and lemon juice in a baking dish. Add asparagus and roll until coated. Grill asparagus on the preheated grill, turning at least once and brushing with remaining oil-lemon juice mixture, until crisp-tender, about 5 minutes. Remove from the grill and place back into the baking dish. Cut into bite-sized pieces. Combine spinach, Parmesan, and almonds in a large bowl. Add asparagus along with any oil-lemon juice mixture from the dish. Toss to blend and serve immediately. Cook’s Note This salad will work great with roasted or air fried asparagus, too. I Made It Print 107 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Asparagus Salad 01 of 05 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 05 Photo by  Gemstariey 12/18/2015 03 of 05 Photo by  RichL 03/15/2015 04 of 05 Photo by  MeggieSuzel 05/10/2008 This was great! Even my husband loved it and he has his own method of grilling asparagus. Did not have any plain parmesan on hand but did have pre-grated 4 cheese italian blend so I threw a couple handfuls of that in. Used honey roasted almonds. Super! name: Heather Hedstrom
instructions: Preheat an outdoor grill for low heat and lightly oil the grate.;Combine oil and lemon juice in a baking dish. Add asparagus and roll until coated.;Grill asparagus on the preheated grill, turning at least once and brushing with remaining oil-lemon juice mixture, until crisp-tender, about 5 minutes. Remove from the grill and place back into the baking dish. Cut into bite-sized pieces.;Combine spinach, Parmesan, and almonds in a large bowl. Add asparagus along with any oil-lemon juice mixture from the dish. Toss to blend and serve immediately.
